11.content:
John was 15 and sick of his normal, boring life. He lived in a normal boring house with a normal boring family. Everyone he knew was boring and acted caustic towards him. He also lived near the sea, and everyday dreamt of going out in the family boat and leaving forever. In fact, for quite some time he had been planning this. After a while of accumulating supplies (it took a quarter of a year) he was ready to go. He headed down to the docks in the early morning one day and glanced out to the sea. It was the only place for him; the was something inside him that couldn't stop him from going to the grand ocean. He looked back at the neighborhood in the distance: his family and childhood. He didn't regret leaving them (sadly, he failed to understand that they deeply loved him).

He climbed aboard the small sail-boat and cut the rope loose. He could sail better than his boring dad, so in no time, he was far from the docks, with the morning breeze in his hair. He had decided to go...
11.title: It Begins

choices: Decided to go for a swim.
Decided to rest for the day.
111.content: He sailed out to open seas, where he quickly lost sight of his old home. He didn't really know why he was heading out here. It was the last place his old friend Jen had been seen. He wanted to find her. She had been looking for mermaids, and their strange enemies, octogirls. Octogirls had supposedly lived out in open oceans, but it was all a myth. Jen had simply died, lost at sea. This saddened John quite a bit. After sailing for several hours, John decided to drop anchor, which is when he...
111.title: Out to open waters. (Octogirls)

choices: Wait and watch the moon reflecting off the sea.
112.content: John decided to follow along the coast so he wouldn't get lost (and disappear like Jen Asute, a girl he used to know, who he was deeply in love with) John knew he shouldn't think about Jen, the only girl who had ever loved him back. He pushed those thoughts out of his mind, and gazed upon the horizon. He had been sailing all day, and decided it would be best to anchor in an uninhabited cove he saw in the distance. Upon anchor, he ate his dinner and looked upon the pristine water. It looked greatly refreshing, and he was tempted to take a dip before he retired to the ships cabin for the night. He decided to...
112.title: Arriving in the cove.

1121.content:
John got into his swim trunks and got ready to enter the perfect waters. He felt the water with his toe, sending ripples across the entire cove. The water was unnaturally, beyond-tropical warm. It must have been because the cove trapped in a great deal of heat from the day. Nonetheless, John could not wait. He jumped in, and rose up. It was like swimming in a giant bathtub. Josh swam and splashed around, trying to entertain himself.

He did not notice the thing swimming around his boat.

After a half hour, John was ready to go back into the boat. He was perfectly ready for a good nights sleep. But Jen came to mind again. He remembered it all. She said she wanted to leave her normal, boring parents with her brother. They left one morning, and their boat was found, empty, in open oceans. A tear rolled down John's cheek. Why did it have to happen?

This question was the same reason John had left. It wasn't because of his boring life. He had come in search of Jen. Jen had always said she was leaving home to find the beautiful mermaids and the mysterious octogirls (she swore they were real). And John did, too. Now he had to find either a mermaid or a octogirl (it was a really outlandish idea) to find out what had happened to Jen.

His thoughts were interupted by a nearby splash. He looked around. Nothing. John was starting to feel hopeless. There were no such things that Jen often talked about. She was probably just joking.

Another splash, this time followed by a giggle. Right behind him. He turned once more. Again, nothing. Something brushed against his toes! He looked down to see a inky figure swimming around only 20 feet down. Could it be? It resembled the mermaid Jen had talked about. The mermaid rose to the surface again, and this time, she stayed.

She had long blond hair that hung down to her tail. Her naked body had not a single imperfection. She appeared to have the body of a 20-year-old female, except for her lower body, why was a purple scaled mermaid tail.

"Hi, who are you" she said in a friendly voice.
John was to surprised to speak. He let out an odd grunt.
"Hehe. You're funny! Do you want to be my friend?" she giggled.
John couldn't talk. He was petrified.
"So do you wanna play?"

John froze. He recalled what Jen said about mermaids. If they wanted to play or be your friend, you get out of there. Why? You're about to find out.
John couldn't respond in time. The mermaid grabbed him and pulled him beneath the surface.
1121.title: These blessed waters

choices: Greeted her and gave her the "last gift". (mental change)
The mermaids know about Jen, and talk about her.
11211.content:
John clamored while the mermaid pulled him deeper and deeper into the cove. He feared he was going to drown. But he also feared one other thing. He struggled and struggled, but he couldn't break free from her grip. She suddenly stopped moving. Her lips met Johns and he felt something odd. His lungs were tingling inside his chest. He struggled more, but his attempts were futile. She moved her face away from his.
"It's already happening. It always starts with the 'mermaid's kiss'" he thought.

He found that he could breath freely in the water. The mermaid swam around him, giggling. Suddenly, another mermaid appeared, and another. They were all swimming around John. That's when they started singing.
"Oh god, no! I should have never come here!" he thought.
The song was oddly beautiful.

John tried to swim away one last time, but the song was too beautiful. He couldn't force himself to leave. The fish girls ripped off Johns swim trunks. The mysterious song started coming out of John's lungs. His voice was of theirs.

John started feeling different after he begun singing along. His legs felt like they were covered in sand or pebbles. He looked down upon them to see his skin turning into skin-colored scales. His feet felt a sudden achy pain as they flattened and lost all bone mass. His upper body was also changing. His breasts were now that of a preteen girl, slightly raised. He continued to sing along. His legs were not very recognizable: they were fully covered in tight scales. He felt his male organ get covered over by the tight scales, which had formed a v-shape around his hips. He could no longer feel it, and it tightened into a vagina. His hair was significantly lengthening. It was also becoming a bluish color. His breasts were now the size of a fully developed women's. He was singing louder, more forcefully. The scaly skin was stretching across the space between his legs and tightening. It was also turning green. His feet were now fused into one green mermaid flipper. His legs pushed against each other and became a mermaid tail. Biologically speaking, John was no longer male. She looked upon herself as she stopped singing.

Her large breasts. Her tail. The large hips. The long blue hair. It shocked her. She looked at the other mermaids. There was something inside her that liked this picture.

Nonetheless, she was not feeling very normal right now. She was definitely torn.

She asked "What now?" Her voice shocked herself.
The mermaids...
11211.title: Sela's New Friend

choices: Yes. (she regains some of the memory lost from the neck ring)
112111.content:
"Hello, sister. How are you feeling? Do you like it?" the first mermaid John met asks.
"I...I don't know. I'm really overwhelmed right now. What do you expect" John replied in her smooth, feminine voice.
She looked at her body. Put her hand on her hypes. She was trying to get used to it, but she yearned to change back.
"It's ok. You're new life will be so much better. Eternal life in a young, beautiful body. No one could ask for more" The mermaid responded.
"I just want to be back to normal. I want to be who I used to be. After all, I don't know how to be a mermaid." John replied.

The mermaids looked at one another.
"I know! He needs the 'final gift' from us." a mermaid with a red tail a flowing brown hair said.
"The final gift?" John did not recall Jen talking about this. In fact, she wished this was all just a dream, that he would have never swam here. But it was real. She whipped her tail about, pondering what was about to happen.
The mermaids swam towards John. She noticed they were holding one of the golden neck rings they all currently had around their necks.
"What are you doing with that?!" John cried, her voice was worried sounding.

The girls made quick work of getting the neck ring around John's neck. It suddenly tightened and became irremovable. John attempted to pull it off,but it was too late.

"What's my name again?" John thought, dazed.
She couldn't remember. She looked at herself. Her body. She was beginning to really like it's feel. The flipper was so wonderful compared to her old, clumsy legs. And her feminine shape was so great. The long hair billowing from her head was beautiful.
"I'm going to love being in this cove, where my sisters will always love me." she said aloud.

The neck ring had decided Johns thoughts, and she was now a full mermaid.
"I'm Meridia. And I love my new life." she giggled happily.
"It's so good to see you finally understand" the red tailed mermaid replied "you do understand we're at war with the octogirls, with their leader Jen."

Meridia froze.
"Who" she said quietly.
"Jen. The child from land the octogirls made queen. Do you know her?" the mermaid (her name is Elsa) asked"

Meridia replied...
112111.title: Becoming Meridia

choices: Shark bandits have a camp near there.
112112.content:
John floated for about five minutes or so before he noticed the small group of mermaids swimming nearby. He spoke to the one that brought him here.
"Look, I know you want to expand your clan but I can't stay here." he said, conjuring all he could remember about mermaids from Jen. "I'm looking for a friend who was lost at sea."
One of the mermaids, one with brown hair and copper colored scales, spoke up.
"If you show us on our sea map we might be able to help you."
John was lead deeper into the huge network of underground sea caverns. There were living areas, much larger then his own. Sea crystals of indescribable beauty grew in the special gardens, pearls were being brought in from other tunnels by other mermaids. Eventually they came to a very large room with a map of the entire worlds oceans. Different parts of the map were colored differently, John later learned that these designated different mermaid clans, areas controlled by their allies dolphins and whales, their rivals the octogirls and their jellyfish allies, the areas controlled by sharks, who act as bandits and raiders.
The copper colored mermaid, who's name was Calista, asked where the empty boat had been found.
"Exactly fourty-eight miles north east of Midway island." he said. He had searched from land for many months and knew every detail of Jen's disappearance. Calista frowned and turned to John to say...
112112.title: The mermaids know about Jen, and talk about her.

choices: Path of Gilbert or Path of Chadwick
1121122.content:
Calista turned to John with a grim look.
"There is a shark encampment not half a mile from that location. It's a large one and we've tried to drive them from it before."
"Could the sharks have caused her to go missing?" John asked. "Would the attack a human ship?"
"Not likely, they've tried in the past and failed. It would have to be a very small craft."
"It's still worth a look isn't it?"
One of the mermaids who hadn't yet spoken replied "we've already lost twenty mermaids to that camp, we can't just walk in there."
"Hold on," Calista (who seemed to be in charge) broke in. "If we help you find your friend, wherever she is, it will come at a cost to you."
"I'll do anything," John said. "I have to find her."
"Then in exchange for our help, you must officially join our clan and when we find your friend she joins us as well."
"Deal." John said, albeit reluctantly.
"Good now you must choose your path."
1121122.title: Shark bandits have a camp near there.

choices: On second thought, let's head for the ship
I don't want this story, pick another
I want to make a story
No, I want to make a story
12.content: Kirsten was walking down the dirt road towards the docks when she noticed the gypsy tent. A fair sized wooden sign stood beside the open tent flaps, written upon it in elegant curved letters was "Madam Aleta, Fortunes and Trinkets". Travelers from far and wide that visited the village said that Aleta was a true gypsy mystic, rather than a wondering thief who pretended to be such. She had some time before the boat was to set sail and a few coins to spare, so Kirsten wondered inside.
12.title: Kirsten

121.content:
The moment she stepped in Kirsten was assailed by the rich aroma of incense and perfume. To her left and right were wooden tables each with dozens of talismans and other objects; golden medallions with images of gods, daggers with jewels set into their golden hilts, and many more caught Kirsten's eye. But she doubted she ever have the gold to buy one if she lived to be a hundred. On the opposite side of the tent was a round table with the ever famous crystal ball. Behind the table was another entrance to the tent, through which Kirsten could see Aleta's wagon and Aleta herself as she fed her horses. Travelers said Aleta was old but beautiful, but at this point all Kirsten could see was that she was indeed beautiful; her long raven black hair shone in the sunlight, her body was toned and lithe, her skin was smooth and tanned by her life on the move. But it was when Aleta came into the tent that Kirsten saw why everyone said Aleta was old. There were no wrinkles of age on her face, but her deep blue eyes bespoke wisdom one only obtains through great age.

"Welcome my dear. Have you come seeking an item of mystical importance, or to see what may be in thy future?" Aleta asked with her melodic yet mystic voice.
121.title: The Gypsy

choices: Uh oh, ship's leaving. Gotta go
1211.content:
"Fortune please." Kirsten replied as she sat down at the round table and pulled four gold coins from her purse.

"My, my, aren't we generously presumptuous." Aleta said with a smile as she sat across from Kirsten.

"Oh, I'm sorry. I-" Kirsten stammered, remembering old tales of misfortune following one after insulting a gypsy.

"It's quite alright dear," Aleta said taking only two of the coins in Kirsten's hand, "Just wait until you are charged next time."


"Now then, let us see what the spirits will tell me about you and what awaits you." Aleta said as she gazed into the crystal ball. After a few moments Kirsten noticed the gypsy's half open eyes glazing over slightly, and then Aleta spoke again. "Ah… I see the ocean and sails; you are going on the ship at the docks to… to seek a new life in a new land, to escape a dark moment in your past."

Kirsten nodded, what the gypsy saw was true. The dark moment was several weeks ago when her parents were murdered and robbed. Then criminal was eventually found and hung for the crimes, but Kirsten still had nightmares of the deed's aftermath and of the man returning for her. As a last resort she was leaving the village, hoping to leave the nightmares behind.
1211.title: Fortune

12111.content:
"Now the future comes to the surface… I see, danger. Some great peril is approaching." The gypsy continued. Kirsten wasn't too surprised; sea voyages were always fraught with peril from storms and sea monsters, she knew she was taking a great risk.

"But there is a light breaking through this cloud of darkness… it's…" The gypsy said before coming out of her trance. She blinked a few times before she stood up and went over to one of the tables covered in trinkets. She returned and set an amulet in front of Kirsten, "I believe this will be of use to you on your journey, a good luck charm of sorts." Aleta said, "Free of charge." She added as Kirsten reached for her purse.
12111.title: Onward to the future

choices: Later when the ship's at sea
121111.content:
Kirsten took a better look at the amulet she'd the gypsy gave her as she continued down to the docks. The amulet was made of a strange blue metal; set into it was an exquisitely carved green gem in the shape of a figure Kirsten knew very well. It was Aquaria; the queen of the sea, a half woman half octopus being that lived and ruled beneath the surface of the sea. Kirsten knew the tales like any other person from a seaside village, and she only knew what an octopus was because the occasional fisherman from the south would bring one of the strange sea creatures with him to the market. Many sailors wore trinkets or tattoos of Aquaria to sway her favor, to grant them calm seas and steady winds and to protect them from the monsters of the ocean.

Kirsten screamed when something yanked her backwards. "Careful there miss, seawater ain't the best for bathing in." The burly sailor who grabbed her collar said.

Kirsten then realized she had been so engrossed in the tales of Aquaria going through her mind she nearly walked off the dock. "Oh, thank you sir. I had my mind elsewhere." She said.

"Not a problem miss, g'day to you." The sailor said tipping his cap before walking away.

Kirsten shook her head at how foolish she had been and put the amulet on around her neck and tucked it beneath her dress, as most sailors had far less ornate medallions and may try to steal hers if they saw it. With her belongings already aboard the ship, and her amulet safely hidden Kirsten boarded the ship herself.
121111.title: To the docks

1211112.content: It was hours later, when the ship had left port and the land was a sliver on the horizon behind them, when the storm came. No one on the ship knew where it had come from; it seemed to come suddenly from nowhere. But that didn't matter much now; the only thing on peoples' minds was surviving the onslaught of icy rain and lightning. Kirsten was trying to find her way around in the dark brought on by the storm when a bolt of lightning struck the ship. Within a moment the sails were ablaze, the fire inextinguishable by the rain. Kirsten stumbled backward in fright, only realizing the railing that once ringed the ship was no longer there. With a terrified scream she fell from the ship and hit the water, and then all went black, save for a blue-green glow from her amulet.
1211112.title: Later when the ship's at sea

12111121.content: Kirsten gasped as she suddenly woke up. The fact she was even waking up after being tossed into the sea was amazing. She glanced around, not that far away was an opening leading out to a beautiful vista of the sea and sky meaning it was day and she was in a cave. With her surroundings identified, Kirsten looked at herself to see if she had been wounded, and gasped again at what she saw. Her dress was gone, as was any clothing she had on, but that paled to what else she saw. Her legs were gone, but in their place was the body and tentacles of an octopus. Kirsten tentatively reached out with her hand and touched one of the tentacles, and felt the touch. Her other hand jumped up to her neck and she felt the amulet Aleta gave her, warm against her bare skin. She grasped the amulet and pulled it to where she could see it better. "Did this amulet do this to me? Did I die and it brought me back like this?" Kirsten wondered aloud.
12111121.title: She awakens

121111211.content: As her ponderings continued Kirsten eventually noticed that her amulet was glowing, most of the glow was concentrated towards the mouth of the cave. Curious Kirsten turned the amulet, watching with amazement as the concentration of glow moved to keep pointing towards the opening. "Is it possible my amulet is trying to lead me somewhere?" Kirsten asked aloud though no one was around to answer. With nothing better to do, Kirsten dove into the water and swam out of the cave. She was pleased to discover that she could breathe under the water and that she could swim, before her transformation she never went deeper than her waist in the nearby ocean. She swam beyond the cave she awoke in eager to see where her amulet would lead her.
121111211.title: The amulet's glowing!

1211112111.content:
The sun was setting above the surface when Kirsten's amulet led her to an undersea cave. Kirsten gazed in amazement at the opening of the cave; it was enormous, easily able to fit a whole galleon. With that momentary pause out of her way Kirsten swam in and eventually emerged in a pocket of air held within a cavern at least as huge as the entrance. The cavern was lit by blue and green plants beneath the water allowing Kirsten to see the most incredible sight she had seen yet. It was a gigantic statue of Aquaria, carved in such detail it seemed as though it were a perfectly still being.

Kirsten swam toward the statue, planning on getting a better look, when she noticed a slab of stone with words carved into it.
1211112111.title: At her destination

12111121111.content: Now curious what exact word were carved into the stone, Kirsten swam towards it. Kirsten was disappointed when she got to the stone to realize she couldn't understand the words, though they were in letters she knew. On a whim she read them aloud. As she finished the last word the glow of the plants and her amulet intensified. She closed her eyes, shielding them from the blinding light, only daring to open them when the glow died down.
12111121111.title: Investigate the stone

choices: Swimming. I'll explore down there myself.
There's no time like the present, right?
121111211111.content:
Kirsten thought she saw the glow shifting a bit, but it was probably just the waves. As she turned to further explore the cave, she noticed the statue shrinking to life-size and gaining life-like color. Could this be Aquaria herself? Kirsten decided to wait the long process out by sitting on a nearby piece of lonely coral. She made the mistake of spreading her legs to sit, which irritated her changed privates. "I didn't think my girly bits had survived the transition. I'll have to explore them later," she said, losing her attention on the statue to rearranging her legs.

"Why wait until later?" the statue asked in a still-stony voice, which startled the young woman. "You humans are always saying there's no time like the present. I brought you here to show you the ropes of being an octogirl, and why shouldn't we start with what you've just noticed?"

"I... uh..." Kirsten stammered. Even though she witnessed the statue coming alive, speaking stones are nonetheless shocking. "Are you Aquaria, Queen of the sea?"

"Of course I am, and you are now my daughter. It's a good thing Aleta gave you the amulet so I could protect you. Of course I can only protect ocean-dwelling creatures, contrary to the sailors' legend, so I could have let you die or transform you. Now then, you had an interesting epiphany a moment ago about your new body?"

"Yes, er... You couldn't have left me the way I was?"

"My dear, I just said that. Did you hit your head on the way off the ship, or are you just embarrassed that I want to talk about your pussy?" By now, the statue was only slightly larger than Kirsten, as an Amazon woman would be compared to an American, and fully lifelike. She swished her tentacles together, and zoomed over to sit near Kirsten.

Kirsten turned red as the coral she was sitting on, "I guess I am embarrassed. I mean, I was taught that we were to share those parts with nobody. It took me forever to think of a window on a ship as a bathroom, instead of a bucket in the smallest closet I could find. My mother was such a prude, my father had to explain sex to me after I got freaked out by my boyfriend wanting to touch me after we made out for the first time."

"My but you've come a long way since then. I'll help you find some seashells and tough seaweed to make a bra out of once we're talking about your new body. Where would you like to start, swimming or what's in the middle of all your legs?"
121111211111.title: Nothing seems to happen

choices: a normal pussy, but octopus colored
some weird looking folds with four clits!
1211112111112.content:
"Well, I think I can figure out how to swim, but private things tend to be a bit more complicated, so lets start with that."

"That's my girl. Now, lets see what you've got." Kirsten started to lift herself up on three tentacles, but Aquaria interrupted her. "No, no, sweetie," she said swooshing away, "You need to see yourself in my mirror."

"You have a mirror down here?" the young octogirl wondered, following her deeper into the cave. Somehow the cave seemed to stay just as bright as outside, but with a different shade of blue to the light.

"Well, once all the algae is wiped off of it, I do. If you would just pose so you can see yourself easily, I can show you exactly what you look like."

Kirsten poses and sees...
1211112111112.title: There's no time like the present, right?

121111211112.content: She gasped once more, opening her eyes to stare into the eyes of the statue. "My Gods, I'm gigantic!" Kirsten exclaimed gleefully. She spent several minutes examining and exploring her new body, but it wasn't long when she felt hunger gnawing her insides. It was time to feed.
121111211112.title: Something's happened

choices: That was yummy, but she need more
1211112111121.content:
Kirsten swam out of the cave, still easily fitting though the tunnel, and gazed around searching for something big enough to satisfy her new hunger. She saw nothing in the moonlight, except for a ripple on the surface. She glanced up to see a small rowboat, most likely someone out for a night on the sea. For a moment she hesitated, pondering the morality of what she wanted to do, but soon she pushed her hesitation aside. She wasn't really human anymore, the rules and morals of humans no longer applied to her. She extended a tentacle upward, silently breaking the surface. With it she grabbed the little boats occupant and dragged them down beneath the waves.

Kirsten smiled as she observed her first catch; a young man who struggled against her grip. After that little pause she opened her mouth, stuffed him in, and closed her mouth; unwrapping and extracting her tentacle after she was sure he couldn't escape. After another moment, this one of tasting the saltwater with the young man's skin, she swallowed.
1211112111121.title: Successful hunt

choices: Switch to someone on the ship
12111121111211.content: She lay upon the ocean floor, savoring the young man's struggles against her stomach walls. Then she noticed a larger ship not too far away. Kirsten licked her lips in anticipation, then swam towards her prize.
12111121111211.title: That was yummy, but she need more

121111211112111.content:
Kristen swam up to the large ship and saw it was a yacht. She swam to the back of the yacht and saw 3 men, a woman and a little girl. Kristen took the 3 men and the woman in 4 of her tentacles and at them. She saw the girl looking at her and realized she just at her parents. Kristen climbed aboard the yacht and started to talk to the girl. They talked for a couple of hours before Kristen was hungry again. Then she saw sharks swarming around the ship and Kristen jumped in. Kristen lord the sharks to her and at all of them. She rubbed her swollen belly and climbed back onto the ship.

“Miss, are you really an octogirl?” the little girl asked.

“Yes I am.” Kristen said.

“Since you ate my parents, can you be my mommy?”

“Of course I will.”

Then Kristen grabbed the little girl with her tentacles and up her into her womb. Kristen left and went back to the cave she found earlier.
121111211112111.title: Stick with Kirsten

121111211112112.content: Are they a man, or a woman?
121111211112112.title: Switch to someone on the ship

1211112111121122.content:
Yuri had this uneasy feeling during the whole voyage, the unshakable sense that something terrible was going to happen. True nothing had happened yet, but the journey was still far from over.

“Yuri, you worry too much.” Her friend Tara said as she walked up to Yuri and leaned on the railing.

“Maybe you’re right Tara.” Yuri said as she started to pace, “Maybe I am a bit of a worrywart.” When Yuri turned back to look at Tara, expecting some motivation from her old friend, but Tara was nowhere in sight.


“Tara? Tara?” Yuri called out, “If this is a joke Tara, it isn’t funny.”
1211112111121122.title: Yuri

12111121111211222.content:
Tara wasn’t in a good spot. While Yuri had been facing away a monstrous tentacle grabbed her, covering her mouth before silently pulling her into the ocean. What Tara saw in the dark waters amazed her. Gazing at her was the gigantic face of a beautiful human woman. Though she only got a short look at the face before it’s owner smiled and opened her mouth, showing Tara her fate.

The temporary shock Tara was in was gone when she saw the giant beauty’s mouth open to accept her. Even though the tentacle’s grip was too tight to escape Tara struggled with all her might. Only when she was within the giant octogirl’s mouth was she released by the tentacle, only to be trapped in the giantess’ closed mouth. It was about then that Tara noticed she needed air; and she got some, when the octogirl swallowed her. Tara managed to get a breath from out of the salty water, but it was cut short by the constricting grip of the throat muscles around her.

A few seconds later Tara landed in a fairly large chamber, undoubtedly the octogirl’s stomach. She cautiously stood up and began to look for a way out, or at least a way to warn the ship above.
12111121111211222.title: Poor Tara

121111211112112222.content: Kirsten moaned in pleasure, the taste of the person was extraordinarily good. She was sure that her moans could be heard from the boat, and had no plans of letting the vessel escape. Kirsten wrapped her tentacles around the edges of the ship, she she was still undetected by anyone. Yuri was still wondering where Tara went, and had gone to tell the captain. Kirsten was stealthily observing the ship's occupants and planning her next moves. Finally she opted for the overt approach and detached most of her tentacles. The appendages tore several sailors from their posts in seconds without bothering to avoid crushing others beneath them. In seconds everyone knew of her arrival and tried to mount a defense.
121111211112112222.title: Back to Kirsten

choices: Lots of fish around, very tasty... and swallowed whole. Odd.
She bumps into a girl scuba diver! Weird, her stomach rumbles louder!
121111212.content:
The amulet looked just it had done before to her. It was rather warm to the touch... or was everything else just cooler now? She could almost feel the amulet getting cooler too. Maybe she just felt heat and cold differently now, more able to cope? That was more than could be said for her mind! She was reeling!

Nervously she flexed her new tentacles and, after some false starts, slowly raised off the ground. She didn't think Octopuses could walk on land... all the ones she'd seen at the market that the fishermen had brought in were all flat out of the water, but moved about once they were underwater again. She seemed to have no trouble. She also seemed to have little trouble getting used to them. At first she stumbled, tipped and staggered around, but in less than a couple of minutes she was moving fluidly, using all eight legs! Incredible! They felt so natural now.

*Gurgglgglglglglug* echoed from below. Was that her? Oooh, she was rather hungry. What did an Octopus girl... Octogirl?.. eat anyway? Fish she supposed.

Slowly she stepped... er, writhed down to the shoreline outside the cave and sighed as the water slipped up around her. It felt wonderfully cool to her skin. It was only after she felt her eyes go under that she wondered if she could breath! Bubbles escaped her lips... but when she held her breath she didn't feel like she was suffocating. Then she felt an automatic pulsing and whooshing from below, just above her tentacles. Two ball like sacks were spitting out water, regularly. She felt it sucked in between all those legs down there... wait, was that a mouth there? She was breathing water from between her legs! Er, tentacles.

This was weird!

Still, she WAS very hungry and in less than a minute mastered swimming (odd, swishing all her tentacles back and forth like that) and took off to search for something to eat.
121111212.title: Octo-hunger

choices: couldn't believe she'd just eaten a person
1211112122.content: As Aleta quickly grew accustomed to the surprisingly natural feeling of swimming with her new octopus arms she felt her stomach continue to growl. Aleta pondered what she could eat, she was seeing fish around but wasn't sure if she could just eat them now or if she should try to bring them out of the water to cook. Aleta was jolted out of her thoughts as she suddenly bumped into something, startled Aleta looked into the equally startled diver she'd just bumped into. The two drifted in the water staring at each other for a moment, and then Aleta heard her stomach rumble louder than she ever had before and her new tentacles began to move as if on their own, like by instinct. The diver tried to push away from Aleta but was quickly seized by the octogirl's tentacles which began to draw her towards the center of Aleta's tentacles, where her new mouth was. Aleta was just as confused as the diver struggling in her grip and considered letting the diver go but just couldn't bring herself to do it, she was too interested in finding out what her tentacles were doing. And then the tentacles shoved the diver's head through Aleta's new mouth in the center of her tentacles, Aleta was suddenly overwhelmed by a wave of pleasure, as the diver was shoved further and further into her it wasn't so much a taste as just a feeling of bliss. Aleta's stomach began to bulge and stretch as it was filled with the diver who was easily as big as Aleta had been before her transformation. Aleta didn't really come to her senses until her tentacles had finished sliding the diver into her second mouth, she looked down at her distended stomach where she could see ripples as the still living diver struggled inside her. It occurred to Aleta that since the diver had an air supply she might live for awhile inside the stomach. As the full realization that she had a person hit Aleta she...
1211112122.title: a new food source

choices: Her boat is spotted by a mermaid/giant mermaid
Her boat is spotted by an octogirl/giant octogirl
123.content: Maria shivered in the night breeze. She didn’t know how far from land her lifeboat was, the ship that she was on had sunk and many of the other passengers hadn’t made it. The rough sea had separated and scattered the survivors, the only thing Maria saw in the moonlight was an endless expanse of water.
123.title: Maria

1231.title: Her boat is spotted by a mermaid/giant mermaid

12311.content:
The rocked in the waves as Maria layers in the center of it, helpless. Maria body is in the worst state it could be in; dehydrated and lacking energy from food, Maria can't move her body. Her visions fades out multiple times, as her body give ups and start to shut down. The only thing Maria has to entertain her mind is the rocking of the boat in the waves.
A sudden splash caught your attention, Maria muscled her head in that direction, nothing. Maria thinks her mind is playing trick, then another splashed, but this time there was something looking over the side of the boat.
It was a girl with red hair, green eyes, and pale as vanilla, Maria stunned and confused, wondering how did another girl get out here. "Is she from the wreck?", no she in to well of shape and Maria been drifting for sometime, "who was it?" Maria is even more confused as the girl climbs over the side.
The girl did not legs, but a scaly, green fish tail, Maria then remember tales of beautiful girls with tails of fish, that lead poor men to there dooms. The girl tries to talk to you body Maria's body was in no shape to listen. There is nothing that Maria could do to stop the girl.
The fish girl then...
12311.title: Regular mermaid

123111.content:
Maria is powerless to stop the girl as she starts to devour her feet. The girl slowly starts to move up Maria's legs, savoring them in her mouth. Maria in a state of shock, looks at the fish girl with hazy stare.
A few minutes pass as the girl is now passed Maria's thigh, Maria still motionless, just accepts it, not knowing when she would pass on, she just knows she would.
The girl just under Maria's breast slows even more down, she is getting tried. Maria lower body forms a lump in the girl's human stomach. The girls picks up again, now extending her mouth to sallow Maria's breast.
Maria's vision goes narrow as her head enter the girls mouth, all that sticks out are Maria's hands. The quickly finishes off Maria's hands and relaxes as the bulge in her throat goes into her stomach.
Maria is forced into a ball in the girl's thigh human stomach. Maria feels the fish girls then leap over the side of the boat, back into the deep, no water enters the stomach as she dives. Soon Maria fades into a sleep from exhaustion.
Maria wake up to...
123111.title: Sallows Maria

1231111.content:
Maria opens her eyes to a fleshy wall of red, she is still inside of the girls human belly because she is in a ball. Maria body feels alittle bit better "odd she thinks. Maria moves to try and get comfy, which is hard, that movement tells the girl you are a wake.
"You are a wake finally" said the girl, who stops swimming and facing up right, "I am not died yet" says Maria, who is a little bit confused.
"No, I didn't eat you to kill you, I ate you to save you" said the girl, Maria still confused " our human stomachs can act like wombs and nurture things in them, so that is what I am doing saving you" said the girl.
"Why" Maria said, "it is true I have eaten a lot of your kind, but I couldn't watch you suffer. Never seen anybody in that bad of shape" said the girl "oh yay my name is Serina", then she continued on and Maria passed out again.
1231111.title: Still being the human belly(safe)

12312.content:
As she lay against the flimsy floor of the wooden lifeboat, she felt a swelling of the water around her, rocking her precarious lifeline to safety. There was nothing on the ocean's surface as far as she could see, but she could see, far beneath, the undulations of a vast and ominous shape. A sigh of despair escaped her. She was in no position to fight. Whatever beast sought to make a meal of her, she had no choice but to surrender to it.

Perhaps, though, "beast" was the wrong word... she saw the outline of a pale hand gleaming in the moonlight as it broke the water's surface.

She sat up, staring in shock and terror, as an arm followed, a shoulder, a neck, a pointed ear, a cheek - then a head, shapely breasts, a whole immense torso, rocking her little lifeboat as salt water spilled over the immense body. The pitch-dark hair curled over the being's shoulders. The feminine lips curled in a coy smile, the eyes closed. They opened, and they were an alluring blue. Then the being's body bent over, arm curling, in an elaborate and formal bow.

"Welcome, visitor to my domain." Mischief glinted in those eyes. "Although by most definitions, you'd be called a trespasser."

Overcome with awe and sudden terror the likes of which she'd never before known, Maria blurted...
12312.title: Giant mermaid

choices: To her chest, forming a small pocket of air with her hands, before diving.
123122.content:
The being's - she was certain it must be some kind of mer-creature, though she'd believed those existed only in myth - eyebrow quirked in mild amusement. "Hmm?"

"Honest, I didn't!" She didn't know why she found herself on her knees before this mermaid, hands clasped, as though begging for her life. Perhaps it was the power in that being's massive form impressing itself upon her. "I was on a ship... I don't know how far from here... it was destroyed, by a beast with horrible tentacles! I was one of the few to survive the shipwreck, and even now I know I may never make it back to land..."

"Calm yourself, little one. I didn't ask for your sob story." The mermaid lowered her head to the lifeboat, bumping the tip of her nose against it. Maria's whole field of vision was filled by the expanse of azure eyes. The creature, if it liked, could fit her, lifeboat and all, into her mouth and swallow her in a single gulp. Maria shivered more now than ever.

"You're cold, aren't you?" said the mermaid.

"O-only a little." Maria stuttered more than she meant to. "It's a cold night. These temperatures aren't good... for humans..."

"So I'm told." The mermaid erected herself to her full height, her entire torso, down to her navel, sticking up from beneath the waves, the fish tail beneath mercifully hidden. Like this, one could have sworn she was human, if not for the size. "Believe me, little one, others of my kin do not take kindly to those land-dwellers who would trespass on their territory, greedy for the riches of the sea. But the great Rena is merciful. If your story is true, then I'll return you safely to land in due time, and there shall be no ill will between us."

"Will you truly?!"

Rena's laugh was vague. "Why, of course..."

"Oh, thank you, thank you!"

"Your gratitude isn't necessary," she answered. "For now, though, it's time to rest, and recover your strength. Permit me to show you to my guest chamber."

As she spoke, Maria felt her scooping up her tiny body in her hands and lifting her into the air. She fit neatly into the depression in the mermaid's palm, the warmth and weight of living flesh beneath her body comforted her against the chill of night. Rena lifted her...
123122.title: "I didn't mean to trespass, honest!"

choices: A calm, safe confinement as Rena transported her back to shore.
1231222.content:
Rena's lips did not seem so gentle now as they gaped open before Maria's tiny body.

"Wait! Wait, I didn't agree to this! You lied to me!"

The hands that grasped her tilted, sending her tumbling into the black hole that was the mermaid's mouth.

"Please don't do this to me! Please let me go!"

The mouth sealed, with Maria within it. There was no way to protest against the salt-water and saliva sloshing about Rena's mouth; indeed, there was barely air to breathe. Maria writhed and struggled as the massive tongue coiled about her, tasting her body, however minuscule it was in comparison to the mermaid. With the teeth locked tight around her, Maria had no room to move; she could only kick against the violating tongue, and that only seemed to move her closer to the black pit of the throat.

At last, the motion abated, but another took its place. Maria felt gravity shift as the mermaid tilted her head, and the throat gaped open to receive her.

Maria saw, as she slipped further and further toward her fate, Rena's mouth opening, a beam of moonlight illuminating the inside of the mouth - perhaps the last light Maria would ever know. It was but a brief flash for her, disappearing as the muscles of the gullet closed around her, and Rena swallowed Maria's writhing body down, the tight tube of the mermaid's throat constricting her, rendering it impossible to fight against the flesh that pushed her down, down to the core of the mermaid's being.

When the gullet's grip released her, Maria found herself in a spacious, dark and humid chamber, where there awaited her...
1231222.title: Deceived?

12312222.content:
"Let me out! LET ME OUT!!" Maria's pleas were strained, thick as her throat was with tears. She clutched at the soft wall of her living tomb, clawing, begging. "Please let me out. I'll do anything! Just don't kill me like this, please!"

"Stop bawling in there. It's disgraceful." Rena's sharp voice cut from all sides, even muffled as it was by her own flesh. "You're not going to die."

"How can you say that?" Maria gasped. "You ate me alive!"

"And if I intended to kill you, I would've crushed your little head between my teeth. Trust me, child, I've other objectives in mind for you."

"But..." Despite the situation she was in, she was inclined to take the giantess at her word. Even so, she had questions she needed answered before it was too late. "But how am I supposed to survive in a place like this?"

"Quite comfortably, I imagine." In the dim light, she saw the wall slightly give against an outside force - Rena's hand caressing her belly. "Others of my species might be ravenous for live humans, but I am not as barbaric as they. My physiology is not even that well adapted to digesting your kind. You'll be well protected in there."

"Safer inside you than out? Really?" She felt compelled to doubt that.

"If I have to pass through the territory of other merfolk, then yes."

The explanation sounded almost sort of plausible, according to a twisted sort of logic. The reality of the situation begged to differ, and yet... and yet, well, Maria had remained alive in here this long, hadn't she? Not knowing, yet - somehow - trusting, Maria placed her hand against the wall where Rena's lay. The mermaid reacted to the touch with a formless noise of agreement, but somehow Maria understood that she meant much more than she said.

"Now as I said, human. Get some rest. It will be many days' journey from here to the nearest inhabited land mass."

"Many days?!" Maria cried.

"Don't fret. Rest for now."

Lulled by the heavenly voice, Maria let her body relax, collapsing to her knees and leaning into the wall of the mermaid's stomach. It had a softness to it, augmented by the pulsing, gurgling ambiance of the body's natural workings surrounding her. It was a strange place to find oneself confined, but, assuming Rena wasn't lying outright, it wasn't really so terrible, either.
12312222.title: Feeling like Jonah yet?

1232.title: Her boat is spotted by an octogirl/giant octogirl

12321.content:
Maria heard the sound of splashing. She turned around, and was surprised to see a girl - no older than 20 - in the water. Even more strangely, she was wearing only a bikini.

"Hey!" she called out. "Are you OK?"

"Oh, I'm fine," the girl replied, swimming over to the lifeboat. She climbed in, and that's when Maria saw them.

The tentacles.

Eight of them.

"What... are you?" Maria asked.

"I'm an octogirl," she replied. "My name is Nelly. I saw your lifeboat. I can help you - I know a safe place."

"Where?"
12321.title: Regular octogirl

123212.content:
Before Maria could react, Nelly lunged forward and kissed her passionately. It felt good - and weird. Maria thought she felt something going down her throat before everything went hazy.

When she woke up, she was still in the lifeboat. She no longer felt cold. Her skin itched beneath her clothing. She had a pair of slits on her sides. And Nelly had now removed her top to reveal a pair of rather enticing breasts.

"What... did you do to me?" Maria asked.

"I kissed you," Nelly smiled. "I also made a few changes to help you survive underwater. You can breathe underwater now - those are gills. And your body can withstand much more pressure. And you no longer have any body hair, except on your head. Instead, you have a thin layer of blubber beneath your skin to keep you warm."

"My skin feels itchy," Maria moaned.

"Side effect of having no hair. Your best bet is to take off your clothes."

Fortunately, Maria wasn't very modest. Her clothes were soon a pile in one corner of the lifeboat. Nelly put them into the first aid kit, which she then removed from the lifeboat itself.

"Are you ready to go?"
123212.title: "Underwater,"

choices: She takes Maria in her tentacles
1232121.content:
Nelly dived into the dark waters, the first aid kit held in one tentacle. Maria followed.

The first thing she noticed was that the water wasn't very cold. The second was that the salt water didn't sting her eyes.

Nelly turned and shouted "Come on!", waving ahead. Maria tried to reply, but all that came out was bubbles.

"You need to empty your lungs of air!" Nelly said. "Breathe in!"

Maria hesitated. Then again, she didn't have much choice. She took a deep breath, and felt the seawater pouring into her lungs, displacing the air. She then felt a new sensation - water passing through her gills.

Confident that she could breathe safely, Maria swam after Nelly. However, while Maria was in good shape, she just couldn't keep up with Nelly. After thirty minutes of swimming, she was exhausted.

Nelly swam up to her. "Sorry! I forgot that humans can't swim well! Here..."
1232121.title: Yes

12321211.content:
Nelly wrapped four of her tentacles around Maria's body. "Shh, I've got you," she whispered.

Maria was surprised at how comfortable it was. It was like being held, only with more arms. The tentacles wrapped tight around her torso, leaving her limbs free. One of them slipped between her breasts. Maria giggled.

With Maria in tow, Nelly took off again. Despite having only four tentacles free, she still swam faster than Maria could. Maria relaxed, enjoying the ride.

Soon, they reached their destination...
12321211.title: She takes Maria in her tentacles

1233.content: Susan sighed as she began her shift. She had been working as a waitress at this sushi restaurant on one of the coastal piers for a few months now, but for almost a week now whenever she went made her rounds she felt as though someone was watching her. But she never saw anyone looking at her for any serious amount of time, and there was certainly nothing in the ocean. But still she felt uneasy.
1233.title: Susan

12331.content: Susan was about halfway through her shift when she felt that feeling again, the feeling that she was being watched. But this time it felt stronger, almost as though something were about to happen. A few seconds later there was a splash and people started screaming. Susan turned to where the pier ended out towards the sea and saw __________ reaching for her.
12331.title: From the deep

1233121.content:
Susan saw an octogirl reaching for her with a muscular looking tentacle. She screamed and tried to run but the tentacle was faster. It wrapped around her ankle, tripping her before it coiled around more of her pinning her arms to her sides and her legs together. Then Susan was dragged back towards the octogirl. “No! Wait! I’m sorry if any of your friends were harmed here, but I had nothing to do with it. I swear! I’m just a waitress.” Susan cried as she tried to wiggle free.

“That’s not why I’m here land-dweller.” The octogirl replied as she pulled Susan closer.

“Then what do you want?” Susan asked nervously.

“Why I want you inside me.” The octogirl chuckled before bringing Susan towards her…
1233121.title: Octogirl

12331212.content:
http://aryion.com/g4/data/122974-2508.jp...

Wha- what are you doing?!” Susan yelled as the octogirl lifted some of her tentacles up to reveal a human-like vagina in the center.

“What does it look like I’m doing?” The octogirl giggled, “Oh, I suppose you humans don’t know, do you? You see, once a month I have a chance to have a child. During that time I have to find a human male to mate with, since there are no males in my race, or I have to find a mermaid or human to bring into my womb if I want a baby. I don’t find human males that interesting, and the mermaids seem to be anywhere around. I’ve been searching around here for a week for the perfect human to make my child.”

“I don’t want to be one of your kind. Let me go!” Susan shouted as she renewed her struggles.
12331212.title: Down Low

14.content: Does she see Humans as equal creatures, or as a snack?
14.title: Giant mermaid

141.content:
You are Coral, a massive mermaid taking up residence on a small oval-shaped island. As islands go, there is not much to see: a river runs through into the ocean from a small lake, allowing you to see what is there, but all that's really there is some old-growth forest and a medium-sized hill near the center. Nevertheless, you have made your home in the lake, declaring the surrounding area your home.

As mermaids go, you're massive: your human half alone is a little over 12 1/2 feet tall! Your tail is covered in small coppery scales and measures about 20 feet long, tipped with a set of fish-like fins, each the size of the flat of a canoe paddle.
You have long, flowing raven hair reaching to your shoulders, a face that would make the most gorgeous supermodel jealous, and brilliant amber eyes.
You're body would make any man, as well as many women, feel lust: your breasts are each as large as a smart car, and your belly has a nice layer of pudge that only adds to your voluptuous body. You have well-developed muscles, but these are concealed under the skin, giving you a slightly robust build
Like all female mermaids, you have a small hole near the base of the tail that is used for disposing of waste products and for mating. Males do have penises, and quite large ones as well, but you have not seen a male human or menfolk in years.
Is this the character for you?
141.title: Coral, Lady of the Isle

choices: A group of fishermen heard about you
There's a strange noise on the shore
1411.content: Well it's a seemingly dull day for you. Despite being a massive mermaid, you find somedays extremely uneventful. That was until...
1411.title: Another day

15.content: Similar choices, but different characters and plots.
15.title: More options

choices: "Meet up on shore tommorow morning to get started. I'll bring my sister too!"
"Spend time getting to know eachother first. I'd like to know more about you..."
152.content:
Alena was rather average as far as giant octogirls go. Her species wasn't generally aggressive toward human, but they would eat some of them on occasion. Alena, on the other hand, was strictly against eating humans. There were plenty of other octogirls who shared her views, and many of them were friends with humans. Alena had never met a human herself, but she was always hoping that she could one day become friends with one of them. Little did she know, that day would be today.

As Alena was swimming through the lake and catching fish with her tentacles to eat later, she heard a splash from above her. She looked up to see what looked like a human flailing wildly to keep from drowning. Alena couldn't just let this poor human drown, so she quickly swam into action. She positioned herself so that her head was directly under the human, and began to swim upward. The drowning human was shocked to feel a small island rising out of the water below them. Looking down, they realized quickly that this wasn't an island; it was a giant head!

Just then, Alena used one of her tentacles to lift the tiny human off of her head and place them in the palm of her hand. As she examined it closer, she realized that the human was a young woman. The woman simply stared up at the colossal octogirl that had just saved her life, not knowing what to say. Just then, Alena made the first comment.

"Are you okay, little human? You're not hurt, are you?"

Snapping back to reality, the woman responded.

"Um, no I'm not hurt... Thank you very much for saving my life Miss..."

"Oh, it was no problem at all! I couldn't just let you drown, could I? By the way, my name is Alena."

"Nice to meet you Alena, my name is Trisha."

"So Trisha, how did you wind up all the way out her in the middle of my lake?"

"This is your lake?"

"Well, essentially yes. I'm the only sentient lifeform living in it, aren't I?"

"I suppose you do have a point... As for how I got here, it's a long story... You see, I was out tending my garden earlier... And right out of nowhere, this giant bird grabs me and carries me away! I managed to struggle free, but I think you know what happened afterward..."

"Ah, that must have been tough... So you don't know how to swim?"

"Know how? Heck! I've never had a body of water big enough to even try swimming in!"

"Hmmm... Well, would you like me to teach you? My home is in a small cove not too far away from here. The water there should be shallow enough to use for swimming practice."

"You'd rally teach me how to swim?"

"Sure thing Trisha! I'd really like to become friends with you."

"Wow, thanks Alena! How about we..."
152.title: Alena the octogirl and her new human friend.

choices: Ignores Trisha, and takes off her underwear
Falls for Trisha's pleadings, and leaves underwear on.
Begins to deep throat Trisha with one of the tentacles to shut her up
1523.content:
Alena held the tiny woman closer to her face and licked her head.
"W-what the hell?" Trisha shouted.
The octogirl didn't say a word. Alena began stripping Trisha of her clothes and when she reached her underwear, she began rubbing one of her tentacles over Trisha's clit.
"Ahh~" Trisha moaned loudly. Alena was always curious what a naked human looked like. She rubbed faster.
"Ah- s-stop it..." The blushing human said.
"I said I want to know more about you. Remember?" Alena responded.
Alena finally stopped. She noticed white sticky stuff coming out from the little one's underwear. Was it her tentacles? No, her tentacle slime was clear; not white. "You're underwear is wet! I guess I have to take it off..." Trisha was stifled at what was about to happen.
"N-no! Please don't do it!" Trisha begged. The Alena stopped for a moment. Should she really do this to her friend?

info.brief_description: What happens when humans tread into the realm of mermaids and octogirls? You decide.
info.description:
I think it should not be necessary for me to point out what a mermaid looks like. Octogirls look like this http://fc01.deviantart.net/fs70/f/2011/052/5/6/takonabe_by_tracinator-d3a4es6.pn... , if it isn't obvious by their name.

Please follow these rules (I reserve the right to edit and/or delete chapters) :
The mermaids and octogirls are about as big as a normal humans, unless otherwise noted in the story
No one-liners
Not too descriptive sex allowed
No scat; if it goes into the sewer DO NOT write about it
